comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.0; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build ID: 20110615151330

Steps to reproduce:

I have two monitors connected.

I middle clicked the browser glass (where the window title is)


Actual results:

Nothing


Expected results:

The window should have switched to the other monitor.
comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.0; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build ID: 20110615151330

Steps to reproduce:

I have two monitors connected.

I middle clicked the browser glass (where the window title is)


Actual results:

Nothing


Expected results:

The window should have switched to the other monitor.
comments.author: blladnar@gmail.com
comments.creator: blladnar@gmail.com

comments.text: I should mention that this works correctly if you move it to the edge and the cursor becomes a resize cursor.
comments.raw_text: I should mention that this works correctly if you move it to the edge and the cursor becomes a resize cursor.
comments.author: blladnar@gmail.com
comments.creator: blladnar@gmail.com

comments.text: Are you using a 3rd party application for this behaviour? I don't believe there is any built in support for middle clicking glass to swap monitors in Windows 7.
comments.raw_text: Are you using a 3rd party application for this behaviour? I don't believe there is any built in support for middle clicking glass to swap monitors in Windows 7.
comments.author: netzen@gmail.com
comments.creator: netzen@gmail.com

comments.author: netzen@gmail.com
comments.creator: netzen@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
After trying a couple different 3rd party apps, I found the software called Display Fusion which has this feature.  

The problem is reproducible if you first install Display Fusion. 
http://www.displayfusion.com/
comments.text:
After trying a couple different 3rd party apps, I found the software called Display Fusion which has this feature.  

The problem is reproducible if you first install Display Fusion. 
http://www.displayfusion.com/
Yes I have Display Fusion installed. I didn't even realize that was a feature of Display Fusion. Sorry about that.
comments.raw_text: Yes I have Display Fusion installed. I didn't even realize that was a feature of Display Fusion. Sorry about that.
comments.author: blladnar@gmail.com
comments.creator: blladnar@gmail.com

comments.raw_text: No problem, thanks for the report.
